input_text:
Job Title: Actuarial Specialist

Location: Iowa, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
At EMC, you'll put your skills to good use as an important member of our team. You can count on gaining valuable experience while contributing to the company's success. EMC strives to hire and retain the best people by engaging, developing and rewarding employees.

Essential Functions

Plans assigned pricing, reserving and/or modeling work streams and manages special projectsMakes recommendations based on analysis and communicates them with external departmentsPeer reviews work to maintain the integrity of the actuarial work product and outlines the timeframes in which the work is completedLeads and conducts independent research and analysisDevelops, maintains, enhances, and documents actuarial tools and techniques required for project or production workDevelops actuarial excel templates for each line of business and every state for the analysis of projectsIncorporates the latest techniques into pricing, reserving and/or modeling functionsServes as subject matter expert in pricing and reserving or predicative modeling for at least two lines of business or other technical actuarial area: Catastrophe Model, Economic Capital Model, or Assumed Reinsurance

Education & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in actuarial science or mathFive years of actuarial experience4-5 exams or equivalent relevant experienceAdditional experience, exams or graduate level coursework may be considered in meeting the requirements

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Excellent knowledge of statistics and probability and computer programmingProficiency in pricing and reserving, or predictive modeling for at least 2 lines of business or proficiency in other technical actuarial area of Catastrophe Model, Economic Capital Model, or Assumed Reinsurance.Thorough knowledge of actuarial terminology, concepts and theoryThorough knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and PowerBI and WordThorough knowledge of at least one computer language, such as R, SAS or SQL preferredAbility to effectively lead a small team and special projectsStrong analytical, investigation and problem-solving abilities

Our employment practices are in accordance with the laws that prohibit discrimination due to race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, active military status, citizenship status, marital status or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws.

All of our locations are tobacco free including in company vehicles.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Actuarial Specialist
output_json.summary: Join EMC as an Actuarial Specialist where you will contribute to the company's success and gain valuable experience.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor’s degree in actuarial science or math
job_responsibilities: Plans assigned pricing, reserving and/or modeling work streams and manages special projects
Makes recommendations based on analysis and communicates them with external departments
Peer reviews work to maintain the integrity of the actuarial work product
Outlines the timeframes in which the work is completed
Leads and conducts independent research and analysis
Develops, maintains, enhances, and documents actuarial tools and techniques required for project or production work
Develops actuarial excel templates for each line of business and every state for the analysis of projects
Incorporates the latest techniques into pricing, reserving and/or modeling functions
Serves as subject matter expert in pricing and reserving or predictive modeling for at least two lines of business or other technical actuarial area
benefits: Engagement in development and reward programs
Tobacco-free environment including in company vehicles
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Our employment practices are in accordance with the laws that prohibit discrimination due to race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, active military status, citizenship status, marital status or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws.
